events.originalText: A lone gunman carried out a mass shooting at a mosque in Quebec City, Canada, killing six people and injuring up to nineteen others.
events.subtitle: Quebec City mosque shooting
events.headline: Mass shooting at Quebec City mosque leaves six dead, nineteen injured

events.originalText: Twenty-one people died when SCAT Airlines Flight 760 crashed near Almaty, Kazakhstan.
events.subtitle: SCAT Airlines Flight 760
events.headline: Twenty-one killed in SCAT Airlines Flight 760 crash near Almaty, Kazakhstan

events.originalText: The Supreme Constitutional Court of Egypt ruled that people who did not adhere to one of the three government-recognised religions are also eligible to receive government identity documents.
events.subtitle: Supreme Constitutional Court (Egypt)
events.headline: Egypt's Supreme Constitutional Court allows non-recognized religion adherents to receive government documents

events.originalText: India's Irfan Pathan became the only bowler to take a Test cricket hat-trick in the opening over of a match.
events.subtitle: India national cricket team
events.headline: Irfan Pathan makes history with Test cricket hat-trick in opening over

events.originalText: The first major ground engagement of the Gulf War began with the Iraqi invasion of Khafji, Saudi Arabia, recaptured three days later by Coalition forces.
events.subtitle: Battle of Khafji
events.headline: Gulf War ground engagement begins with Iraqi invasion of Khafji, Saudi Arabia

events.originalText: The Mantra-Rock Dance (poster pictured), called the "ultimate high" of the hippie era, took place in San Francisco, featuring Swami Bhaktivedanta, Janis Joplin, the Grateful Dead, and Allen Ginsberg.
events.subtitle: Mantra-Rock Dance
events.headline: Mantra-Rock Dance in San Francisco features Swami Bhaktivedanta, Janis Joplin, and more

events.originalText: World War II: At least 38 civilians were killed and about a dozen others injured when the Polish village of Koniuchy was attacked by a Soviet partisan unit with a contingent of Jewish partisans.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Soviet partisan unit attacks Polish village of Koniuchy, killing 38 civilians

events.originalText: World War II: The Battle of Rennell Island, the last major naval engagement between the United States Navy and the Imperial Japanese Navy during the Guadalcanal campaign, began.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Battle of Rennell Island marks last major naval engagement between US and Japanese navies in Guadalcanal campaign

events.originalText: Charles Curtis of Kansas became the first Native American U.S. Senator.
events.subtitle: Charles Curtis
events.headline: Charles Curtis becomes first Native American US Senator

events.originalText: Liliʻuokalani, the last monarch and only queen regnant of the Hawaiian Kingdom, ascended the throne.
events.subtitle: Liliʻuokalani
events.headline: Liliʻuokalani ascends throne as last monarch of Hawaiian Kingdom

events.originalText: Queen Victoria introduced the Victoria Cross, originally to recognise acts of valour by British military personnel during the Crimean War.
events.subtitle: Queen Victoria
events.headline: Queen Victoria introduces Victoria Cross for acts of valour during Crimean War

events.originalText: War of the Sixth Coalition: At the Battle of Brienne, both sides' commanders, Napoleon and Gebhard Leberecht von Blücher, were nearly captured.
events.subtitle: War of the Sixth Coalition
events.headline: Battle of Brienne sees Napoleon and Blücher nearly captured
